Stephen.text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
Stephen.notes: • Was originally just "15 inch" but a specific range was requested after Federico's pick was read.

Stephen.text: No Intel Macs are left on sale (as new) at the end of 2023
Stephen.notes: • "Does not include the refurbished or educational stores." Or, in other words, the Intel Mac Minis and Mac Pro are not sold as new anymore (and of course they don't introduce a new Intel Mac).

Stephen.text: WWDC 2023 follows the same format as WWDC 2022, with a small number of people invited in person
Stephen.notes: • No convention center, no ticket lottery, just like in 2022.

Stephen.text: Apple shows off at least one iOS 16 feature that we havenâ€™t seen before
iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once (reuse)
Stephen.notes:
• Was originally "The Lightning port on the iPhone 14 Pro is upgraded to at least USB 3.0", but it turns out this has been rumored. This prompts a rule change. Stephen thought of a few options which became Flexies, but ultimately opts to reuse Federico's Risky pick from the last game, word for word (a legal choice under the Bill).
  • Federico, oddly, argues for this being correct, with the Dynamic Island allowing multiple app use. But the others agree that, while funny, that isn't it.

Stephen.text: The Apple Watch SE, announced in 2020, moves down in price with no feature changes
Stephen.notes: • Not graded: Series 7 or SE 2 takes the middle price point where the SE is now

Myke.notes:
• Seems inevitable but it might be a bit ahead of its time.
  • Ungraded: might just be the Pro phones, to advertise the improved transfer speeds.

Myke.text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air
Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October
AirPods Max 2 can be folded to store more compactly
Myke.notes: • Myke doesn't seem to have much confidence in this risky pick, but his other choices were shot down as insufficiently risky in negotiations.

Myke.text: At least one iPhone gets an upgraded main camera
At least one iPhone will have the notch removed, replaced by a cut-out(s) for the camera and sensors, free-floating from the border
Myke.notes: • Or, as Stephen so poetically put it, "AKA an island of black glass in an ocean of pixels." Little did he know that Apple would actually call it "the Dynamic Island".

Federico.text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
Federico.notes: • Ungraded: Probably the same design but with an M2 chip. More Thunderbolt ports would be nice.

Federico.text: Apple will release its biggest iPad ever with a display of at least 16 inches...
Federico.notes: • "... It won't be OLED, it'll have the front-facing camera on the landscape side, and two USB-C ports at least. It'll be called iPad Studio."

Federico.text: There will not be an iPhone 15 mini
At least one of the next 'Pro' iPhones will have an always-on display
The iPhone 14 Pro Camera app introduces some kind of 3D capturing functionality
There won't be a mini iPhone in the iPhone 14 family
Federico.notes:
• Federico basically steals one of Myke's ongoing annual picks, which is allowed by the rules.
